name: Paneer Bhurji Scramble
instructions: Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and the oil starts to separate.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook for 1-2 minutes, adding a splash of water if needed to prevent burning.
Crumble the paneer directly into the pan. Mix gently to combine with the मसाला (masala).
Add chopped bell peppers (capsicum) and cook for another 3-5 minutes, allowing the paneer to absorb the flavors, but without overcooking.
Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with whole wheat roti or as a protein-rich side dish.

name: Masala Egg Bhurji (Scrambled Eggs)
instructions: Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk whole eggs and egg whites with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan with the cooked masala. Let it set for a few seconds, then scramble gently with a spatula.
Cook until the eggs are just set but still moist. Do not overcook.
Stir in garam masala and garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with whole wheat toast or roti.

name: High-Protein Moong Dal Cheela with Paneer Filling
instructions: Wash and soak moong dal for at least 4 hours or overnight. Drain thoroughly.
Blend the soaked moong dal with ginger, green chili, a little water (about 1/4 cup) to a smooth, pourable batter. Add cumin powder and salt to the batter.
For the filling: In a bowl, crumble paneer. Add finely chopped onion, green chili, coriander leaves, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Heat a non-stick tawa (griddle) over medium heat. Lightly grease with oil.
Pour a ladleful of batter onto the hot tawa and spread it evenly in a circular motion to form a thin cheela (pancake).
Drizzle a little oil around the edges and cook until the base turns golden brown and crispy.
Spread a portion of the paneer filling over half of the cheela. Cook for another minute, then carefully fold the cheela in half.
Cook for another minute until the filling is warm. Repeat for the remaining batter and filling (makes 4 cheelas, 2 per serving).
Serve hot with green chutney or yogurt.

name: Spicy Soya Chunks Curry
instructions: Boil soya chunks in plenty of water with a pinch of salt for 5 minutes. Drain, rinse under cold water, and squeeze out excess water completely.
Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook until tomatoes soften and oil separates.
Add the squeezed soya chunks to the masala. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Pour 1 cup of water, bring to a simmer, cover, and cook for 10-12 minutes, allowing the soya chunks to absorb the flavors and gravy to thicken.
Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with brown rice or whole wheat roti.

name: High-Protein Rajma Masala
instructions: Wash and soak rajma (kidney beans) overnight. Drain and pressure cook with fresh water for 8-10 whistles until soft. Reserve some cooking liquid.
Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, and cardamom. Let them splutter.
Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook until oil separates and tomatoes are mashed.
Stir in the cooked rajma along with some of its cooking liquid. Bring to a simmer.
Add Greek yogurt and mix well to prevent curdling. Cook covered for 15-20 minutes on low heat, allowing flavors to meld and gravy to thicken.
Season with salt to taste and mash some rajma against the side of the pan for a creamier texture. Garnish with fresh coriander.
Serve hot with brown rice or whole wheat roti.

name: Tofu Paneer Bhurji with Spinach
instructions: Press tofu to remove excess water, then crumble it. Crumble paneer as well.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala.
Add the crumbled tofu and paneer to the pan. Mix gently to combine with the masala.
Add chopped spinach, cover, and cook for 3-5 minutes until spinach wilts and moisture evaporates.
Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with whole wheat roti or as a protein-rich side.

name: Healthy Dal Makhani
instructions: Wash and soak black urad dal and rajma overnight. Drain and pressure cook together with fresh water and a pinch of salt for 10-12 whistles until very soft and creamy. Mash a little with a spoon.
Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, and green cardamom. Let them splutter.
Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until oil separates.
Add the cooked dal and rajma to the masala. Add about 1 cup of water and bring to a simmer. Cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
In a small bowl, whisk Greek yogurt until smooth. Slowly stir into the simmering dal (ensure heat is low to prevent curdling). Cook for another 5-7 minutes.
Stir in garam masala and kashmiri red chili powder (for color, optional). Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander.
Serve hot with brown rice or whole wheat roti.

name: Grilled Chicken Tikka Skewers
instructions: Cut chicken breast into 1-inch cubes. In a bowl, combine Greek yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, salt, and lemon juice. Add 1 tbsp oil.
Add chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring they are well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 4 hours.
Preheat grill or oven to medium-high (or air fryer to 190°C/375°F).
Thread chicken pieces onto skewers, alternating with bell pepper and onion pieces if desired.
Grill or bake for 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and lightly charred. If using an air fryer, cook for 10-12 minutes, shaking basket halfway.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with a side of mint chutney or salad.

name: Spicy Prawn Masala
instructions: Clean and devein prawns. Marinate with a pinch of salt and turmeric powder for 5 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add the marinated prawns to the pan. Cook on medium-high heat for 3-5 minutes, stirring gently, until prawns turn pink and are cooked through. Be careful not to overcook as they can become rubbery.
Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with brown rice or whole wheat roti.

name: Lean Chicken Keema Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, and cardamom. Let them splutter.
Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute.
Add lean chicken mince and cook on medium-high heat, breaking up lumps, until it browns and all moisture evaporates.
Stir in chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook until oil separates.
Add green peas and 1/2 cup of water. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook for 10-12 minutes until chicken is cooked through and peas are tender.
Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with brown rice, whole wheat roti, or cauliflower rice for a low-carb option.

name: High-Protein Fish Curry (Goan Style)
instructions: Cut fish fillets into 2-inch pieces. Marinate with a pinch of salt and turmeric powder for 5 minutes.
Grind or blend chopped onion, ginger, garlic, green chilies, coriander powder, red chili powder, and cumin powder with a little water to a smooth paste.
Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add curry leaves.
Add the ground masala paste and sauté for 5-7 minutes until the raw smell disappears and oil starts to separate.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Stir in light coconut milk and 1/2 cup of water. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Gently slide the marinated fish pieces into the simmering gravy. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until fish is opaque and cooked through.
Season with salt to taste. Add a squeeze of tamarind paste or lemon juice for tanginess. Garnish with fresh coriander.
Serve hot with brown rice or as a light, protein-rich meal.

ingredients.name: firm white fish fillets (e.g., cod, tilapia)

name: Chicken & Spinach Scramble
instructions: If using raw chicken, dice it finely and sauté in a pan with a little oil until cooked through. Set aside. (Or use pre-cooked shredded chicken).
Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add finely chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add chopped spinach and cook until it wilts and most of its moisture evaporates.
Add the cooked chicken to the pan. Season with turmeric powder, red chili powder, and a pinch of garam masala. Mix well.
In a bowl, whisk eggs with salt and black pepper.
Pour the egg mixture over the chicken and spinach. Let it set for a few seconds, then scramble gently.
Cook until eggs are just set but still moist. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot as a high-protein breakfast or light lunch.

name: Quick Tandoori Chicken Wraps
instructions: Cut chicken breast into thin strips. In a bowl, combine Greek yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, tandoori masala, red chili powder, salt, and lemon juice. Add chicken strips and mix well. Marinate for 15-20 minutes.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Add marinated chicken strips and cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and lightly charred.
Warm whole wheat rotis on a tawa or pan. Prepare the salad by mixing sliced cucumber, onion, tomato, and fresh mint leaves.
Spread a thin layer of mint chutney or Greek yogurt on each warm roti. Place cooked tandoori chicken strips and a portion of the fresh salad mix in the center.
Roll up the rotis tightly and serve immediately.

name: Protein-Rich Chana Dal & Spinach Curry
instructions: Wash and soak chana dal for at least 30 minutes. Drain. Pressure cook with fresh water and a pinch of salt for 4-5 whistles until tender but not mushy. Drain excess water, if any.
Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook until oil separates.
Add the cooked chana dal and chopped spinach. Stir well. Add 1/4 cup of water, cover, and cook for 5-7 minutes until spinach wilts and flavors meld.
Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves and a squeeze of lemon juice.
Serve hot with brown rice or whole wheat roti.

name: High-Protein Chicken and Chickpea Salad (Desi Style)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked chicken breast, cooked chickpeas, diced cucumber, chopped red onion, and chopped tomatoes.
For the dressing, whisk together Greek yogurt, lemon juice, chopped mint leaves, chaat masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Pour the dressing over the chicken and vegetable mixture. Toss gently to ensure everything is well coated.
Chill for 10-15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld. Garnish with extra mint leaves if desired.
Serve as a light, refreshing, and protein-packed meal or snack.

name: Chicken Tikka Salad Bowl with Mint Chutney Dressing
instructions: Prepare chicken tikka: Dice chicken breast. Marinate with 1/2 of the Greek yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, tandoori masala, salt, and lemon juice for 15 minutes.
Cook chicken: Heat 1 tsp oil in a non-stick pan. Cook marinated chicken pieces until golden brown and cooked through, about 8-10 minutes. Set aside.
Assemble salad: In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, sliced cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion.
Prepare dressing: In a small bowl, whisk remaining Greek yogurt with mint leaves, green chili, a pinch of salt, and a dash of lemon juice.
Combine: Add the cooked chicken tikka to the salad bowl. Drizzle with the mint chutney dressing.
Toss gently and serve immediately as a complete meal.

name: Sprouted Moong Dal & Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds, let them splutter.
Add chopped onion and sauté until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, cook for 1 minute.
Add chopped carrots, bell peppers, and green beans. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Add the sprouted moong dal, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes.
Season with salt and a squeeze of lemon juice. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot as a light meal or a healthy snack.

name: Protein-Packed Tofu Scramble with Indian Spices
instructions: Press tofu to remove excess water, then crumble it into small pieces.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add the crumbled tofu to the pan. Season with nutritional yeast (for a cheesy flavor, optional), kala namak (black salt), and regular salt.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tofu is heated through and has absorbed the flavors. Do not overcook as it can become dry.
Stir in garam masala. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with whole wheat toast or as a high-protein side dish.

name: Andhra Style Chicken Fry (Dry)
instructions: Cut chicken breast into 1-inch pieces. Marinate with ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt for at least 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves, let them splutter.
Add finely chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add the marinated chicken pieces to the pan. Cook on medium-high heat for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and lightly browned.
Sprinkle garam masala and black pepper powder. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until the chicken is well coated with spices and slightly crisp.
Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves and a squeeze of lemon juice.
Serve hot as a dry side dish with dal and brown rice, or with whole wheat roti.

name: Paneer Peas Bhurji with Bell Peppers
instructions: Crumble paneer. If using frozen peas, thaw them.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add chopped bell peppers and green peas. Cook for 3-4 minutes until vegetables are slightly tender.
Add the crumbled paneer to the pan. Mix gently to combine with the masala. Cook for another 3-5 minutes, allowing paneer to absorb flavors.
Season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with whole wheat roti or as a protein-rich side dish.

name: Scrambled Eggs with Smoked Salmon & Spinach
instructions: Heat olive oil or butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Add spinach and sauté until wilted, about 1-2 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk eggs with milk, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Pour egg mixture into the same pan (add a little more oil if needed). Cook, stirring gently, until eggs are mostly set but still slightly moist.
Fold in the cooked spinach and smoked salmon pieces. Cook for another minute until heated through.
Serve immediately, topped with a sprinkle of fresh dill if desired.

name: High-Protein Cottage Cheese Pancakes
instructions: In a blender or food processor, combine cottage cheese, egg, whole wheat flour, protein powder, baking powder, vanilla extract, and sweetener (if using). Blend until smooth.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with cooking spray or a tiny bit of oil.
Pour approximately 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the hot surface.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve immediately with fresh berries and a drizzle of sugar-free syrup if desired.

name: Savory Tofu Scramble with Black Beans
instructions: Press extra-firm tofu for at least 15 minutes to remove excess water, then crumble it into a bowl. Season with nutritional yeast, turmeric, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add diced onion and bell pepper, and sauté for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add the seasoned tofu to the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes until it starts to brown slightly.
Stir in the drained and rinsed black beans and continue to cook for another 2-3 minutes until everything is heated through.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and a side of avocado slices.

name: Greek Yogurt Protein Bowl with Berries & Nuts
instructions: In a bowl, combine Greek yogurt and protein powder. Mix well until smooth and fully combined. If too thick, add a tiny splash of milk or water.
Top with mixed berries, a sprinkle of chopped almonds, and a drizzle of honey or maple syrup if desired.

name: Grilled Chicken & Avocado Salad
instructions: Pat chicken breast dry and season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.

Heat olive oil in a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Grill chicken for 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through and internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C). Let it rest for a few minutes, then slice.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and avocado slices.
For the dressing, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.
Add the sliced grilled chicken to the salad. Drizzle with dressing and toss gently to combine. Serve immediately.

name: Quick Tuna Melt on Whole Wheat
instructions: Drain tuna well and flake into a bowl. Mix with light mayonnaise, finely diced celery, red onion, salt, and pepper.
Toast one slice of whole wheat bread until lightly golden. Spread the tuna mixture evenly over the toast.
Top with cheddar cheese slice. You can either place it under a broiler for 2-3 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly, or microwave for 30-60 seconds until cheese is melted.
Serve hot, optionally garnished with a sprinkle of fresh parsley.

name: Chickpea Salad Protein Wrap
instructions: In a bowl, mash chickpeas with a fork until mostly smooth but still a bit chunky.
Stir in Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, finely diced celery, red onion, and fresh dill. Season with salt and pepper.
Lay out a high-protein tortilla or large lettuce leaves. Spread the chickpea salad evenly down the center.
Add mixed greens and any other desired veggies like shredded carrots or bell pepper strips.
Roll up tightly and serve immediately.

ingredients.name: high-protein tortilla or large lettuce leaves

name: Turkey & Hummus Protein Box
instructions: Arrange the sliced turkey breast, hummus, cucumber slices, bell pepper strips, and whole wheat pita bread (or crackers) neatly in a meal prep container or on a plate.
Serve with a sprinkle of paprika on the hummus if desired.

name: Baked Salmon with Roasted Broccoli & Quinoa
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cook quinoa according to package directions. Typically, combine 1/2 cup quinoa with 1 cup water, bring to boil, then simmer covered for 15 minutes until water is absorbed.
Toss broccoli florets with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet.
Place salmon fillet on the same baking sheet. Drizzle with 1/2 tbsp olive oil, lemon juice, and season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Roast for 15-20 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily, and broccoli is tender-crisp.
Serve the baked salmon and roasted broccoli alongside the cooked quinoa.

name: Lean Ground Beef and Veggie Skillet
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet or non-stick pan over medium-high heat.
Add lean ground beef and cook, breaking it apart with a spoon, until browned. Drain any excess fat.
Stir in diced onion and garlic, and cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Add diced zucchini, bell pepper, and tomato paste. Season with Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in beef broth and let it simmer for a few minutes until slightly reduced.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

ingredients.name: extra lean ground beef (90% lean or higher)

name: Chicken Breast with Roasted Sweet Potato & Green Beans
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss diced sweet potato with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika on a baking sheet. Roast for 15 minutes.
While sweet potato roasts, pat chicken breast dry. Season with garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.

After 15 minutes, add green beans (tossed with 1/2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper) and the seasoned chicken breast to the baking sheet. You can place the chicken directly on the sheet or on a small piece of parchment paper next to the veggies.
Continue roasting for another 15-20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through (internal temperature 165°F/74°C) and vegetables are tender.

name: Hearty Lentil & Vegetable Stew
instructions: Rinse lentils thoroughly. Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add diced onion, carrots, and celery. Sauté for 5-7 minutes until softened.
Stir in minced garlic, tomato paste, and Italian seasoning. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add rinsed lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Remove bay leaf. Stir in fresh spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, optionally topped with a dollop of Greek yogurt or a sprinkle of fresh parsley.

name: Halloumi & Veggie Skewers with Quinoa
instructions: If using wooden skewers, soak them in water for at least 30 minutes.
Cook quinoa according to package directions. (1/2 cup quinoa with 1 cup water, simmer for 15 mins).
Cut halloumi into 1-inch cubes. Cut bell peppers and zucchini into similar-sized pieces.
In a bowl, toss halloumi and vegetables with olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Thread the halloumi and vegetables alternately onto the skewers.
Heat a grill pan or outdoor grill to medium-high heat. Grill skewers for 3-4 minutes per side, turning until halloumi is golden brown and vegetables are tender-crisp.
Serve the grilled skewers immediately alongside the cooked quinoa.

ingredients.name: bell peppers (various colors, cut into 1-inch pieces)

name: High-Protein Chicken & Black Bean Burrito Bowl
instructions: Cook brown rice according to package directions. (1/2 cup dry with 1 cup water, simmer 20-25 mins).

Season chicken breast with chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. Heat 1 tsp olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for 6-8 minutes per side until cooked through. Let rest, then dice or shred.
In the same skillet, add drained and rinsed black beans, corn, and a splash of water or chicken broth. Heat through, stirring in a squeeze of lime juice.
Assemble the bowl: place cooked brown rice at the bottom. Top with diced chicken, black bean and corn mixture, avocado slices, and a dollop of Greek yogurt or sour cream.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.

ingredients.name: plain Greek yogurt or light sour cream

name: Tofu & Peanut Stir-fry with Brown Rice
instructions: Press firm tofu for at least 15 minutes, then cut into 1-inch cubes. Toss with 1 tsp cornstarch, salt, and pepper.
Cook brown rice according to package directions. (1/2 cup dry with 1 cup water, simmer 20-25 mins).
Prepare stir-fry sauce: Whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, maple syrup, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic in a small bowl.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add tofu cubes and cook until golden brown and crispy on all sides, about 8-10 minutes. Remove tofu and set aside.
Add remaining 1 tsp olive oil to the pan (if needed). Add broccoli florets and bell pepper strips. Stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Return tofu to the pan. Pour in the stir-fry sauce and cook, stirring, until the sauce thickens and coats the tofu and vegetables, about 2-3 minutes.
Stir in chopped peanuts. Serve hot over cooked brown rice, garnished with green onions.

name: Sheet Pan Italian Sausage & Peppers
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss sliced bell peppers and onion with olive oil, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Add Italian sausage links to the bowl and toss to coat with the seasonings.
Spread the sausages and vegetables in a single layer on a large baking sheet.

Roast for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway through, until sausages are cooked through (internal temperature 160°F/71°C for pork, 165°F/74°C for chicken/turkey) and vegetables are tender with slightly browned edges.
Serve hot, optionally with a sprinkle of fresh parsley.

ingredients.name: lean Italian sausage links (pork, chicken, or turkey)

name: Creamy Tuna Pasta with Peas
instructions: Cook protein pasta according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water before draining.
While pasta cooks, drain tuna well. In a large bowl, flake tuna and mix with Greek yogurt, lemon juice, dried dill (or fresh if available), salt, and pepper.
Add the cooked and drained pasta to the tuna mixture. Add frozen peas and toss to combine.
If the mixture is too thick, add a little of the reserved pasta water until it reaches desired creaminess.
Serve warm, garnished with extra fresh dill or grated Parmesan cheese if desired.

ingredients.name: high-protein pasta (e.g., lentil, chickpea, or protein-enriched)

name: Baked Cod with Roasted Root Vegetables
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss chopped carrots, parsnips, and red onion with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. Spread them in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast for 15 minutes.
While vegetables roast, pat cod fillets dry. Drizzle with 1 tbsp olive oil and lemon juice. Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
After 15 minutes, push vegetables to one side of the baking sheet and place cod fillets on the other side.
Return to oven and roast for another 12-15 minutes, or until cod is opaque and flakes easily and vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
Serve immediately, optionally garnished with fresh parsley.

name: Spicy Peanut Butter Chicken
instructions: Cut chicken breasts into 1-inch pieces. Season with salt and pepper.
Prepare sauce: In a bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, sriracha, grated ginger, and minced garlic. Add a tablespoon or two of water to thin if needed.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove chicken from the pan and set aside.
Add bell pepper strips to the pan and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.
Return chicken to the pan. Pour the peanut sauce over the chicken and bell peppers. Stir well to coat everything, and cook for 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
Serve hot over brown rice or with a side of steamed vegetables, garnished with chopped peanuts and green onions.
